ygData.subject: Re: Re:Re: Guise of the Deceiver (Longish)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... You can always tell when people haven t been to SolB.  8) 0 people in SolB is rough (will never happen tho). 24 people in SolB imo is perfect (4 groups can
ygData.messageBody:
> My biggest problem with too many folks in an area isn't nothing to hunt -
> or having to grab a mob before someone else does

You can always tell when people haven't been to SolB. 8)

0 people in SolB is rough (will never happen tho).
24 people in SolB imo is perfect (4 groups can run the whole place)
32 people seems to be average (my happiness is declining however)
40+ people is bad (and I get irritable. lots of complaining in ooc
about who stole whose kobold. or ten people shouting for groups
or a list to even get into groups. just plain nasty)

On Innoruuk, we have waiting lists to get into specific room
groups, such as the king+adjoining rooms and the bat/bug entrance.
On E'ci I heard 3 separate groups each take the king, priest, champ.

When you grow up, your tune will change silky. You all think unrest
and highkeep are bad, you aint seen nothing yet.

Harmonic.
